description.narrative: The project#s development objective (PDO) is to promote environmentally sustainable urban transport in India and to improve the usage of environment-friendly transport modes through demonstration projects in selected cities.

Department of Economic Affairs, Government of India

title.narrative: ITS systems and units are installed, functioning, and utilized at Indore for at least 80% of their intended of revenue vehicle kilometers of service by project end.
NAYA RAIPUR - Atleast two public transport corridors are established and in operation between Naya Raipur and Raipur
NAYA RAIPUR - Safe sidewalks and cycle tracks are provided on the main roads of Naya Raipur
ITS systems and units are installed, functioning, and utilized at Mysore for at least 80% of their intended of revenue vehicle kilometers of service by project end.
Pimpri-Chinchwad - Modal share by public transport increases
Number of environmentally friendly urban transport practices and approaches provided by the project that are adopted by cities
Naya Raipur: Public transport trip mode share between Raipur and Naya Raipur increases
Pimpri-Chinchwad - At least two BRT Corridors operational
Hubli-Dharwad - Public transport mode share increases
HUBLI DHARWAD - Safe pedestrian access to BRT

target.value: Stations, footpath, FoB, traffic signal phasing in place

actual.value: Footpath, foot-over-bridges, traffic signal phasing under implementation

title.narrative: PIMPRI CHINCHWAD - Percentage of displaced families that are resettled in alternative houses
MoUD partners with states/cities to develop capacity and support cities in sustainable local solutions
Hubli Dharwad: Percentage of Project affected people received Compensation and Resettlement assistance.
HUBLI DHARWAD - BRT corridor is operational
Mysore - PBS system installed and functioning

actual.value: PBS launched on 4 June, 2017 and fully functioning
